views package¶

This Package contains all the views handlers

views.issue module¶

This module contains the business logic for the single Issue view

views.issue.issue_page(issue_id)[source]¶

Renders an issue page given its issue id. contains all the infos of the isse and manages the Amazon API

Parameters:issue_id – issue id as defined in the model
Returns:renders the “issue_page.html” template or redirects to index with a 302 html code if the issue is not found

views.show_series module¶

This modue manages the “Show Series” view.

views.show_series.get_all_issues()[source]¶

Responds to a POST request, showing all the issues in the view

Returns:json object with all the issues in the database ordered by date
views.show_series.get_series()[source]¶

Fetch the requested series via POST

Returns:returns a JSON object containing all the issues from the series; ordered by date
views.show_series.show_series_page()[source]¶

Renders the “show series” page

Returns:renders the “show_series.html” template

views.user_page module¶

This module contains the logic for the “user_page.html” temmplate

views.user_page.add_user_series()[source]¶

Adds requested series in the user’s series

Returns:renders the user page
views.user_page.remove_user_series()[source]¶

remove requested series from the user’s series list

Returns:renders user page
views.user_page.show_user_page()[source]¶

renders the user page

Returns:renders the user_page template

views.user_specials module¶

This module contains the logic for handling the user specials model in the template

views.user_specials.add_special_issue()[source]¶

Adds requested issue via POST to the user’s specials list

Returns:JSON object with operation outcome
views.user_specials.get_specials()[source]¶

Retrieves user’s special issues.

Returns:JSON object with user’s special issues object
views.user_specials.remove_special_issue()[source]¶

Removes requested issue via POST from the user’s specials list

Returns:JSON object with operation outcome
